postTitle: Account Executive Mexico (Billingual Spanish-English) at Bobtail
jobTitle: Account Executive Mexico (Billingual Spanish-English) at Bobtail
descContent:
### **About Bobtail**

Bobtail is dedicated to increasing happiness for our customers by eliminating
inefficiencies in the supply chain. We envision a supply chain without
friction, fraud, waste, and abuse where companies succeed based on the value
they create.

We work uniquely at Bobtail, where we value teams over individuals and
encourage experimentation and iteration to constantly improve. Teams are given
flexibility in working towards a shared purpose and given the freedom to
decide how they will accomplish their goals.

If you are an out-of-the-box thinker who takes a proactive approach to
collaborating with others to solve problems and achieve your goals - we would
love to talk to you.

The things we value:

  * Mission
  * Teams over individuals
  * Collaboration
  * Communication
  * Iteration
  * Experimentation and failing fast
  * Initiative and solutions-oriented approach
  * Documentation
  * Data
  * Mental health and work-life balance
  * Diversity
  * Transparency

**You should apply if you have:**

  * 3 years of B2B cold calling & outbound sales experience
  * Fluency in English is a must 
  * Software as a Service (SaaS) Nice to have 
  * US Trucking Industry knowledge is a plus
  * CRM usage experience is preferred (Salesforce is a plus)
  * Start-up experience is a plus
  * Ability to quickly learn in a fast-paced environment,
  * Consistent track record of achievement and hitting quotas
  * Confidence, as well as strong verbal & written communication skills when interacting with clients
  * Ability to discover and understand customer needs and propose solutions
  * Dependable team player
  * A motivated, driven, self-starter‚Ä¶ We love those with grit and accountability!
  * You must own a modern laptop with a working camera that is not older than 3 years.
  * An Internet Speed of 50 Mbps is required

**You will be responsible for:**

  * Making daily cold calls & sending emails/text to connect with prospects
  * Converting prospects & leads into Bobtail clients
  * Collaborating as a team to accomplish individual, team, and company-wide goals
  * Maintaining a pipeline of leads and opportunities using our CRM (Salesforce)
  * Effectively using other sales tools to track progress and improve your performance
  * Learning about each client‚Äôs needs, industry, and competitors.
  * Building long-lasting, mutually beneficial relationships with prospects and clients to create a better customer experience.
  * Following up with prospects throughout the sales cycle to continue nurturing them.
  * Presenting the value of Bobtail products and services to prospects
  * Staying current on company offerings and industry trends.

**Educational background:**

  * Bachelor‚Äôs degree preferred
  * Sales or business education/certification preferred
  * Completed studies preferred  
  

**Benefits:**

  * Monthly Mental Break Day
  * Paid Time Off
  * Work from home (or wherever)
  * Parental leave

  
Creating a diverse and inclusive workplace is Bobtail‚Äôs nucleus. We are an
equal opportunity employer and embrace people of different backgrounds,
cultures, religions, national origins, races, colors, genders, gender
expressions, sexual orientations, ages, marital status, veteran status,
experiences, abilities, and perspectives.

postTitle: Crypto Trading Trainee / Market Analysis Associate at BEGINI LTD
jobTitle: Crypto Trading Trainee / Market Analysis Associate at BEGINI LTD
descContent:
Begini is an international, fast-growing company operating in the digital
asset and market analytics space. We create an environment where motivated
newcomers can gain hands-on experience and grow into professional crypto
market specialists.

We are looking for an entry-level candidate who is eager to learn, work with
real market data, and develop trading skills under the guidance of experienced
mentors.

### **Key Responsibilities**

  * Assist in executing trading operations on cryptocurrency markets.

  * Monitor price movements, volume changes, and overall market behavior.

  * Record and maintain transaction data and performance metrics.

  * Analyze charts, market data, and news to support trading decisions.

  * Work with analytical platforms and collaborate with the trading team.

  * Gradually build and refine your own trading strategy.

### **What We Offer**

  * Opportunity to join a young, international, and growing company.

  * Fully remote work ‚Äî location independent.

  * Flexible schedule up to 20 hours per week, ideal to combine with studies or other commitments.

  * Structured training from scratch with continuous mentor support.

  * Clear career growth path and transition to more advanced roles.

### **Ideal Candidate Profile**

  * Strong interest in cryptocurrency markets, blockchain, or financial trading (experience not required).

  * Willingness to learn fast, adapt, and develop new skills from the ground up.

  * High attention to detail and accuracy when working with data and real market operations.

  * Ability to work independently and manage time effectively in a remote environment.

  * Responsible, reliable, and committed to completing tasks.

  * Motivated to grow professionally within the company.

  * English level B2 or higher ‚Äî required to work with analytics, tools, and international news sources.

postTitle: Intern Business/System Analyst (worldwide remote, work anywhere) at CloudLinux
jobTitle: Intern Business/System Analyst (worldwide remote, work anywhere) at CloudLinux
descContent:
We are looking for an **Intern Business Analyst** to join our CloudLinux
Network (CLN) team.

CLN is a core platform that powers billing, licensing, and customer management
across our products and brands (CloudLinux and TuxCare brands, including
CloudLinux OS, Imunify, KernelCare, Extended Lifecycle Support, and Enterprise
Support products). It serves thousands of global customers and directly
impacts revenue, customer trust, and user experience.

As an Intern BA, you will work closely with the Product Owner to support the
delivery of new product features, improve internal workflows, analyze
requirements, and ensure the smooth operation of key business processes. You
will contribute to billing logic, licensing flows, permissions, API
improvements, and UX consistency across the platform.

  
This role is ideal for someone with 1+ years of experience who wants rapid
growth in a complex product environment.

**As an Intern Business Analyst, you will:**

  * Write and maintain product requirements, user stories, acceptance criteria, and use-case scenarios.
  * Support feature development for billing, subscriptions, licensing, permissions, and customer workflows.
  * Participate in planning sessions, standups, grooming meetings, retrospectives, and design reviews as a full member of the CLN team.
  * Assist in resolving customer-impacting issues.
  * Collect user and stakeholder feedback to refine product usability and discoverability.
  * Work with data teams to analyze billing-related tickets, refund patterns, subscription events, and customer behaviors.
  * Preparing structured summaries and insights from raw data.
  * Performing manual data review or manual data entry when needed (e.g., testing edge cases, validating billing scenarios, helping diagnose customer issues).
  * Supporting internal cleanup and data-quality initiatives.

**Requirements**

**To be successful in this role, you should have:**

  * 1+ year of experience as an Intern Business Analyst, or in a similar product role.
  * Ability to create clear, structured requirements.
  * Basic understanding of REST APIs (Swagger, request/response flow, error codes).
  * Basic knowledge of Postman. 
  * Knowledge of SQL or experience with BI tools (Looker, Redash, Snowflake).
  * Technical background or understanding of JSON, logs, and API debugging.
  * Strong analytical thinking and attention to detail.
  * English - Advanced. 

**Nice-to-have:**

  * Experience with billing systems or financial workflows.

  * Familiarity with Jira, Confluence, Notion, Slite, or similar tools.

**Personal skills:**

  * Fast-learning and proactive.
  * Strong ownership and self-organization.
  * Comfortable working in a fast-paced, distributed team.
  * Able to analyze tasks independently and propose logical solutions.
  * Excellent communication and teamwork skills.

**Internship details:**

  * 6 months internship with the opportunity to transition to a full-time contract in case of successful completion of the internship

**Benefits**

**What's in it for you?**

  * Work on real project tasks in an Agile team

  * A strong focus on professional development with opportunities for learning and growth:
    * Interesting and challenging projects,
    * Mentor and other knowledge-exchange programs, 
  * Fully remote work with flexible working hours, that allows you to schedule your day and work from any location worldwide;
  * 10 days of national holidays, and unlimited sick leaves to ensure you maintain a healthy work-life balance;
  * Compensation for private medical insurance;
  * Co-working and gym/sports reimbursement;
  * The opportunity to receive a reward for the most innovative idea that the company can patent, fostering a culture of creativity and innovation.

_By applying for this position, you consent to the processing of your personal
data as described in our Privacy Policy (_<https://cloudlinux.com/candidate-
privacy-notice>_), which provides detailed information on how we maintain and
handle your data._

### About Us

Circle is building the world‚Äôs leading all-in-one platform for online
communities. We make it possible for creators, coaches, educators, and
businesses to bring together their audience with engaging discussions, live
streams, events, chat, courses, and payments ‚Äî all in one place, all under
their own brand.

We‚Äôre proud to be a fully remote company of around 200 (and growing!) team
members from 30+ countries around the world. We seek exceptional individuals
around the world, set them up to do the best work of their lives, and in turn,
create a meaningful impact in their own lives. We don't track hours, but we do
manage for high expectations very closely. We collaborate across time zones,
are highly async, and like to document a lot.

Twice a year, we bring the whole company together in beautiful places around
the world for our company offsites. So far, we‚Äôve hosted offsites in Turkey,
Portugal, Mexico, Thailand, Colombia, Italy, Ireland, and more, with still
more to come!

Check out our [Careers](https://careers.circle.so/) page for more about
working at Circle.

### About the role

We‚Äôre looking for an Operations Associate who excels in a fast-paced
environment to help keep Circle running smoothly as we scale.

This is a company-ops, generalist role: you‚Äôll own cross-functional projects
that cut across the entire company (finance, legal, product, GTM, and data).
From your first day, you‚Äôll take on meaningful responsibilities with a direct
impact on our core business and product success.

In this role, you‚Äôll support company priorities that unlock growth and enable
efficient, scalable operations. You‚Äôll own high-priority initiatives end-to-
end ‚Äî from concept to launch ‚Äî by building project plans, defining success
metrics, driving execution, and ensuring smooth rollouts.

This is a high-trust, high-impact role for someone who can see around corners,
drive outcomes without authority, bring structure to complexity, and turn
ambiguity into action.

### What you'll be doing

  * Contribute to strategic analyses, support project management, and collaborate closely with cross-functional stakeholders across finance, legal, product, GTM, and data
  * Take ownership of tasks from vague problem ‚Üí clear solution ‚Üí shipped outcome
  * Turn operational data into clear dashboards (using spreadsheets, SQL, or other analytics tools) and surface insights that inform decisions and drive execution
  * Build a deep understanding of Circle‚Äôs operational workflows and processes
  * Build and maintain lightweight tracking systems for ongoing operational workflows (e.g. Discover listings, submissions, approvals, status tracking)
  * Be the person people trust to ‚Äújust handle it‚Äù - following through reliably with clear communication

### What you'll need to be successful

  * A strong generalist skill set (e.g. creating clear, actionable project plans and memos, analyzing data sets, and tackling ad hoc projects)
  * Experience driving cross-functional projects or programs in ambiguous, fast-changing environments
  * Ability to interpret data, identify patterns, and clearly communicate findings to inform decision-making
  * High ownership, low ego, and willingness to work across both high-stakes strategic projects and detailed execution.
  * A desire to work in an environment which values speed of iteration and individual autonomy, while also embracing personal accountability and the ability to collaborate effectively as part of a dynamic team.
  * Comfortable in a fast-paced environment with a certain level of ambiguity, especially when learning and picking up new technologies or systems when projects require it.
  * Strong alignment with our values, [**find our values on our career page**](https://circle.so/careers) if you haven‚Äôt read up on them yet.
  * You are proficient in English (spoken, written, and reading) at a [**CEFR Level C2**](https://magoosh.com/english-speaking/english-proficiency-levels-a-guide-to-determining-your-level/) / [**ILR Level 5**](https://www.govtilr.org/).

### $80,000 - $100,000 USD per year

_The cash compensation range shown is a starting point. In addition to equity,
benefits and perks, your cash compensation is subject to an annual review and
increase on a once per year basis._

### The fun stuff

  * Fully remote: work from anywhere in the world!
  * Autonomy and trust to do your job: we care about outcomes over everything else.
  * Paid time away: all employees are given 35 days of PTO annually. We also offer a paid sabbatical after 5 years.
  * Generous U.S. benchmarked compensation and startup equity no matter where you are in the world.*
  * Awesome medical coverage with 100% coverage for you and your family, or medical reimbursement options where applicable!*
  * Parental leave for parents expanding their family, or just starting one.
  * Home office stipend to help you get up and running.
  * Learning & development stipend to help you level up your professional skills.
  * Annual bonus potential for roles that don't already receive variable income or commission.
  * Company retreats: Twice a year, the Circle team gets together for a fully paid company retreat in incredible places around the world! We‚Äôve had past retreats in Colombia, Portugal, and Mexico, with more planned on the horizon.
  * Check out our [Careers](https://careers.circle.so/) page for more.

*_Your role, location and unique circumstance may affect this._

### Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

As a fully-remote international company, diversity is baked into our DNA.
Here‚Äôs how our CEO, Sid Yadav, frames our hiring mission: ‚Äúlet‚Äôs find talent
in underserved and under-represented corners of the world, set them up to do
the best work of their lives, and in turn, change their life.‚Äù To achieve this
hiring mission, we offer competitive U.S. benchmarked compensation no matter
where someone‚Äôs located in the world, and we proactively seek candidates who
expand representation of backgrounds, cultures and lived experiences in our
teams.

### Equal Employment Opportunity

Circle is an equal opportunity employer and as such, we do not discriminate on
the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity,
national origin, age, disability, or any other characteristic protected by
applicable laws. If you require any accommodations during the recruitment
process, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

### How We Use Candidate Data

At Circle, we are committed to protecting your personal information. As a job
applicant, the personal data you provide to us is collected and processed in
accordance with the **General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)** in the EU
and the **California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA)**. This notice outlines the
types of personal information we collect, the purpose for collecting it, and
your rights.

**Information We Collect:** We collect the following categories of personal
information from job applicants:

  * Contact information (such as name, email address, phone number)
  * Employment history and qualifications
  * Education history
  * References and any other information you choose to share with us during the application process

**Purpose of Collection:** We collect this information for the following
purposes:

  * To assess your qualifications and suitability for the position
  * To communicate with you during the recruitment process
  * To comply with legal and regulatory obligations

**Your Rights Under GDPR and CCPA:** You have the following rights regarding
your personal information:

  * The right to request access to the personal information we hold about you.
  * The right to request the deletion of your personal information, subject to certain legal exceptions.
  * The right to opt out of the sale of your personal information (Note: We do not sell personal information).

For more information about how we handle your personal data or to exercise
your rights, please refer to our full [Privacy
Policy](https://circle.so/privacy).

By submitting your application, you acknowledge that you have read and
understood this privacy notice.

postTitle: Strategic Account Executive at Chili Piper
jobTitle: Strategic Account Executive at Chili Piper
descContent:
### **About Chili Piper**

Chili Piper is a B2B SaaS startup. Our product helps clients turn inbound
leads into qualified meetings instantly, helping revenue teams connect to
buyers faster. We are a fully remote global team dedicated to solving
interesting problems, helping others, and having fun.

We‚Äôre growing fast and we're ready to take over the world (in the most civil
and appropriate way possible, of course).

_***CURRENTLY CONSIDERING CANDIDATES BASED BETWEEN PST - GMT+3; MUST BE
WILLING TO WORK US HOURS***_

###  **Overview**

We‚Äôre hiring a Strategic Account Executive to drive net-new revenue in our
Strategic segment. This is a full-cycle role designed for a seller who can
create demand, run complex deal cycles, and consistently close high-quality
pipeline.

You‚Äôll own the full motion end-to-end, from initial account strategy and
outbound creation through discovery, multi-threading, procurement, and close.
You‚Äôll be partnered with a **dedicated Strategic SDR** who leads the outbound
motion, while you own full-cycle execution and conversion. Success in this
role requires tight collaboration across **SDR, Marketing, and Partnerships**
to continuously refine messaging, increase outbound effectiveness, scale
repeatable pipeline creation, win new logos and expand our footprint.

### **Key Metrics**

  * Closed/won revenue (quota attainment)- across net new business + on base

  * Pipeline coverage and pipeline quality (strategic fit + stage integrity)

  * Win rate and cycle time

  * Forecast accuracy and on-time close performance

  * ACV and strategic deal mix progression

### **Responsibilities**

  * Own the full sales cycle from demo to close

  * Build and execute account plans for Strategic targets, identifying the highest-probability paths to close.

  * Run executive-level discovery that ties business outcomes to measurable value and a clear decision process.

  * Build strong, multi-threaded relationships across stakeholders (economic buyer, champions, power users, security/procurement).

  * Drive process discipline: clear next steps, mutual action plans, consistent deal hygiene, and risk management.

  * Maintain high-quality CRM rigor (stages reflect truth, notes are usable, and forecasts are accurate).

  * Partner closely with a Strategic SDR focused on outbound execution, aligning on account strategy, targeting, sequencing, and conversion plays.

  * Collaborate with Marketing, SDR, and Partnerships to refine and scale messaging, improve outbound performance, increase conversion across channels and support land/expand motions.

  * Translate outbound learnings into repeatable talk tracks, positioning, and account-based plays that create consistent pipeline across Strategic accounts.

### **Qualifications**

**Minimum Requirements**

  * 5+ years in strategic or enterprise sales.

  * Strong track record selling SaaS solutions into complex organizations.

  * Proven ability to close net-new revenue, manage multi-threaded/committee based sales cycles, and engage senior leadership.

  * Confident in managing full commercial ownership of deals with high discipline in pipeline management, forecasting, and deal strategy

  * Strong communication skills, clear, direct, and executive-ready.

**Preferred**

  * Experience with Chili Piper

  * Experience selling into RevOps, Sales Ops, Marketing Ops, or GTM leadership

  * Experience working with product-led stakeholders + technical buyers (security, IT, procurement)

  * Familiarity with scheduling automation, inbound conversion, routing, or lifecycle revenue workflows

  * Prior experience in a category-building environment or early scaling org

  * Based in United States

### **Additional Information**

**Why you'll love being a part of our team:**

Our team loves Chili Piper because [we‚Äôre building the company of the future.
](https://www.chilipiper.com/post/company-of-the-future)

  * Work with an immensely talented global team

  * Work in a business that‚Äôs run fairly and transparently

  * Competitive pay based on market rate wherever you live

  * We lead by example--showing industry peers and leaders how to innovate, improve, and grow--while having fun

**How we work:**

  * **Freedom and flexibility.** We‚Äôre a 100% distributed team working from around the world, and we've been fully remote since 2016.  _**Our team members can work from wherever they want**_ in the world, as long as they show up on our weekly all hands meeting on Zoom.

  * **Solve interesting problems.** The software landscape has exploded. There are dozens of solutions for each problem. We want to be different. We come up with new angles on existing problems or invent better solutions to help companies with their sales and marketing. Then we turn these ideas into beautiful, smart software.

  * **Autonomy and ownership.** Working on a distributed team means you don‚Äôt have someone micromanaging you or looking over your shoulder to make sure you‚Äôre getting things done. We‚Äôre a team of do-ers who take full ownership for their results.

  * **Be helpful.** Our first value as a company is help. Help our customers be successful. Help our prospects get the right information and make the right decision whether or not it includes our products. Help our team members reach their full potential.

**The perks:**

  * Unlimited vacation (and we _do_ mean it, and we _do_ take it!)

  * Generous health, dental, and vision insurance

  * Any equipment/software/tech that you need to do your job

  * Annual professional development stipend of $2,000 USD

  * Equity - all Pipers receive stock options

  * Annual company retreat for a week of bonding and adventure (previous retreat locations include Paris, Morocco, Tulum, Iceland, Ibiza, and India!)

postTitle: API Engineer (NASA or APAC) at Supabase
jobTitle: API Engineer (NASA or APAC) at Supabase
descContent:
Supabase is the Postgres development platform, built by developers for
developers. We provide a complete backend solution including Database, Auth,
Storage, Edge Functions, Realtime, and Vector Search. All services are deeply
integrated and designed for growth.

### **The team:**

[Management API](https://supabase.com/features/management-api), written in
[TypeScript](https://www.typescriptlang.org/), [Nest.js](https://nestjs.com/)
and other JavaScript technologies, is a central part of every product in the
Supabase stack. It allows all Supabase services and [Supabase
Studio](https://supabase.com/dashboard) communicate with each other,
programmatically manage your own Supabase projects and organizations, as well
as integrate with 3rd party services like
[Vercel](https://vercel.com/marketplace/supabase),
[Resend](https://resend.com/supabase), or
[Lovable](https://docs.lovable.dev/integrations/supabase). We are seeking
someone to help us maintain existing API, expand OAuth applications
capabilities, enhance reliability, and improve overall public API experience.

**This is a fully remote role and we're accepting candidates located in NASA
(North & South America) or APAC (Asia-Pacific) regions.**

### **What you'll own:**

  * Design, implement, and maintain both internal and public-facing APIs used across various Supabase products, including Studio, CLI, management APIs, and OAuth applications.

  * Integrate with third-party platforms and partners, either by developing custom integrations or providing clear API points for them to connect with Supabase.

  * Collaborate closely with various teams across Supabase (DevOps, Frontend, etc.) to ensure smooth integration and implementation of API functionality for the rest of the platform.

  * Build and enhance testing, debugging, and monitoring tools to ensure public APIs' stability, reliability, and performance.

  * Design, build, and enhance tools for testing, debugging, and monitoring to ensure the stability, reliability, and performance of public APIs.

### **What you bring:**

  * 5+ years of experience in backend API development, with strong expertise in TypeScript and JavaScript (Node.js) and familiarity with modern tools and frameworks (e.g., Nest.js, Express, Vitest, Zod).

  * Expertise in designing robust, scalable, and maintainable APIs, and experience with API versioning, pagination, and error handling best practices. Experience with OAuth, JWT, and API security best practices (rate limiting, CORS, etc.) is a plus.

  * Good understanding of PostgreSQL and relational databases.

  * Proven ability to build scalable, maintainable APIs and develop tools for testing, debugging, and monitoring API performance.

  * Understanding of CI/CD pipelines, Docker, and containerized deployments to streamline API development, testing, and release processes.

### **What We Offer**

  * **Fully Remote**

We hire globally. We believe you can do your best work from anywhere. There
are no Supabase offices, but we provide a WeWork membership or co-working
allowance you can use anywhere in the world.

  * **ESOP**

Every team member receives ESOP (equity ownership) in the company. We want
everyone to share in the upside of what we‚Äôre building together.

  * **Tech Allowance**

Use this budget to set up your ideal work environment‚Äîlaptop, monitor,
headphones, or whatever helps you do your best work.

  * **Health Benefits**

Supabase covers 100% of health insurance for employees and 80% for dependents,
wherever you are. Your wellbeing and your family‚Äôs health are important to us.

  * **Annual Off-Sites**

Once a year, the entire company gathers in a new city for a week of
connection, collaboration, and fun. It‚Äôs a highlight of our year.

  * **Flexible Work**

We operate asynchronously and trust you to manage your own time. You know what
needs to be done and when.

  * **Professional Development**

Every team member receives an annual education allowance to spend on
learning‚Äîcourses, books, conferences, or anything that supports your growth.

### **About the Team**

Supabase was born-remote and open-source-first. We believe our globally
distributed team is our secret weapon in building tools developers love.

  * 180+ team members

  * 40+ countries

  * 15+ languages spoken

  * $496M raised

  * 430,000+ community members

  * 30,000+ memes posted (and counting)

We move fast, build in public, and use what we ship. If it‚Äôs in your project,
we probably use it in ours too. We believe deeply in the open-source ecosystem
and strive to support‚Äînot replace‚Äîexisting tools and communities.

### **Hiring Process**

We keep things simple, async-friendly, and respectful of your time:

  1. Apply ‚Äì Our team will review your application.

  2. Intro Call ‚Äì A short video chat to get to know each other.

  3. Interviews ‚Äì Up to four calls with:

     * Founders

     * Future teammates

     * Someone cross-functional from product, growth, or engineering (depending on the role)

  4. Decision ‚Äì We may follow up with a final question or go straight to offer.

All communication is remote and we aim to move fast.

postTitle: Team Lead for Packaging Engineering Team (remote-only, Europe & CIS) at CloudLinux
jobTitle: Team Lead for Packaging Engineering Team (remote-only, Europe & CIS) at CloudLinux
descContent:
**CloudLinux** is a global remote-first company. We are driven by our
principles: do the right thing, employees first, we are remote first, and we
deliver high-volume, low-cost Linux infrastructure and security products that
help companies to increase the efficiency of their operations. Every person on
our team supports each other and does what we can to ensure we all are
successful. We are truly a great place to work!

Check out our website for more information: <https://cloudlinux.com/>

**Endless Lifecycle Support (ELS)** enables organizations to continue securely
using Linux distributions and software languages that have reached the end of
life or no longer receive standard security support ‚Äì delivering vulnerability
patches for unsupported versions of CentOS, Ubuntu, Debian, Oracle Linux, PHP,
Python, Spring frameworks, Angular/AngularJS, Django, Flask.

For more information, visit our website: <https://tuxcare.com/endless-
lifecycle-support/>

**We are looking for a talented Team Lead to join the Alternatives &
EasyApache Team on the CloudLinux OS Web Stack project within ELS. **This role
involves working with a range of products, including alternative versions of
NodeJS, PHP, Python, and Ruby, as well as cPanel EasyApache and HardenedPHP
packages.

The alternative packages enable the installation of multiple versions of the
same software on a single system and are utilized across various CloudLinux OS
and Imunify360 components. While EasyApache packages are originally part of
the cPanel product, our team enhances them to ensure greater security and
seamless compatibility with CloudLinux OS.

HardenedPHP focuses on backporting security patches to PHP versions that are
no longer supported by the PHP community.

More information can be found here:[ https://www.cloudlinux.com/security-
features/#hardened-php](https://www.cloudlinux.com/security-
features/#hardened-php)

**As our Team Lead, you will take ownership of the full lifecycle of package
development, including:**

  * Communication with stakeholders (resolving clients' issues through the support team, other departments/teams, etc.)
  * Driving the automation of routine tasks such as version updates, patch management, monitoring, and testing to streamline the packaging workflow
  * Designing and maintaining automated test suites
  * Being a part of the release management processes
  * Building working processes and workflows in the team 
  * Being responsible for Agile (Scrum) delivery and Jira workflow management

**Requirements**

**To thrive in this role, we are looking for someone who has:**

  * Team management experience - 3+ years
  * Experience in developing, implementing, and applying automation
  * 3+ years of experience working with GNU/Linux operating systems and shell scripting experience
  * Experience with Python - at least 1 year
  * Experience working with AI tools (ChatGPT, Cursor, etc.)
  * Experience with Agile practices 
  * Strong communication and leadership skills 
  * English - upper-intermediate+

**It will be a plus if you also have:**

  * Understanding of RPM or DEB package build systems (e.g., mock, pbuilder, etc.)
  * Experience using CI/CD tools such as Jenkins, Ansible, or similar
  * Experience with –° programming

**Benefits**

**What's in it for you?**

  * A strong focus on professional development with opportunities for learning and growth:
    * Interesting and challenging projects,
    * Mentor and other knowledge-exchange programs;
  * Fully remote work with flexible working hours, that allows you to schedule your day and work from any location worldwide;
  * Paid 24 days of vacation per year, 10 days of national holidays, and unlimited sick leaves to ensure you maintain a healthy work-life balance;
  * Compensation for private medical insurance;
  * Co-working and gym/sports reimbursement;
  * The opportunity to receive a reward for the most innovative idea that the company can patent, fostering a culture of creativity and innovation.

  
_By applying for this position, you consent to the processing of your personal
data as described in our Privacy Policy (_[_https://cloudlinux.com/candidate-
privacy-notice_](https://cloudlinux.com/candidate-privacy-notice) _), which
provides detailed information on how we maintain and handle your data._

Elemental Terra is a young and rapidly developing company working in the field
of digital markets and analytics. We bring together enterprising people who
want to master modern approaches to trading, analysis and decision-making in a
dynamic market environment.

We are currently looking for a **Junior Crypto Analyst & Trader** , a novice
specialist who is ready to complete training, perform real trading operations
and develop under the guidance of experienced mentors.

### Your Responsibilities

  * Perform simple trading operations under the guidance of a mentor.
  * Execution and support of trading operations on digital markets.
  * Tracking asset dynamics and market trends.
  * Maintaining internal records on transactions and statistics.
  * Analyzing market data, news, and charts for decision-making.
  * Work with analytical tools and participate in discussions with a team of traders.
  * The gradual formation and improvement of your own trading strategy.

### What We Offer

  * Working for a young and growing international company.
  * Remote format ‚Äî you can work from anywhere in the world.
  * Flexible schedule ‚Äî up to 20 hours per week, convenient to combine with study or main activity.
  * Learning from scratch ‚Äî all processes and trading tools are mastered with a mentor.
  * Access to real trading environments and current market data.
  * Growth possibilities ‚Äî after training you move to the next level of tasks.
  * Support at every stage ‚Äî you will always have a mentor and experienced traders.

Please mention the word **PRETTILY** when applying to show you read the job
post completely (#RMTAzLjE5MC40MC4xNTU=). This is a feature to avoid fake spam
applicants. Companies can search these words to find applicants that read this
and instantly see they're human.

$50,000 ‚Äî $70,000/year

As **Chief Publishing Officer** , you will define and lead Crytek‚Äôs global
publishing strategy, working closely with the COO and CTO, reporting to the
Co-CEO. You will deliver exceptional player experiences while driving strong
revenue growth across our portfolio.

  

You will direct a talented team of product leads, communications director,
head of sales, and creative marketing director. Together, you‚Äôll build and
execute a publishing framework that integrates a consistent approach to
product strategy, brand marketing, communications, sales, insights, and
community engagement to grow and retain our player base.

  

This role demands commercial acumen, creative vision, and operational
excellence. You will partner closely with game leadership and fellow
executives to empower every product for success in alignment with Crytek‚Äôs
long-term strategy.

### Responsibilities

* Build and lead Crytek‚Äôs global publishing strategy, integrating marketing, commercial operations, communications, and franchise management under a unified framework with clearly defined success criteria 
* Shape long-term portfolio and market growth strategies, leveraging player insights, emerging trends, and scalable systems to deliver sustainable success 
* Drive player acquisition, retention, engagement, and monetization through data-informed lifecycle strategies and unified insights platforms 
* Lead global brand positioning and creative storytelling, ensuring narrative cohesion and cultural relevance across channels and regions 
* Build scalable systems and processes that unify products and empower teams under a connected publishing operating model 
* Partner with company and game leadership to align creative ambition with business planning, revenue growth, and market expansion 
* Collaborate with commercial, finance, and forecasting teams to establish enterprise-aligned business planning and performance management practices 
* Champion organizational transformation and culture, simplifying structures, accelerating decision-making, and fostering innovation and adaptability 
,

### Required Qualifications

* 10+ years of senior leadership in publishing, commercial, product, or marketing roles, with at least 5 of these years in the video games industry 
* Proven success driving global franchise growth and live service ecosystems, connecting creative vision to measurable business outcomes 
* Deep expertise in audience segmentation, platform ecosystems, and data-informed marketing, including insights, AI, and automation 
* Track record delivering global go-to-market strategies and managing complex IP portfolios 
* Strong leadership skills with experience building teams, mentoring talent, and influencing across matrixed organizations 
* Excellent communication skills in English and ability to navigate complex situations with clarity and empathy 
* Passion for video games and a deep understanding of player communities 
* Willingness to relocate to Frankfurt am Main, Germany 

**What you can expect from us**

  

**Career Path**

Your professional development is important to us, so we have laid out a career
plan to help you progress towards your goals and objectives.

  

**Relocation Support**

We offer a relocation budget and full coverage of flights to Frankfurt for you
and your family.

You can expect extensive assistance with visa, work permits, and communication
with authorities during the relocation process, as well as help settling into
Germany (e.g. setting up appointments with banks, government agencies,
schools, landlords, finding apartments etc.).

  

**Company Apartment**

To help you get settled, we provide you with a fully furnished company
apartment during your first three months in Frankfurt.

  

**Public Transport Pass**

Discover Frankfurt by bus, tram and metro ‚Äì free of charge.

**Gym Card**

A healthy body is a healthy mind. We offer a membership at the premium gym
chain Fitness First in Germany. Work out, join group fitness classes, or relax
in the wellness facilities.

  

**State-of-the-art Office**

We‚Äôve recently moved into a brand-new, modern office located in the heart of
Frankfurt. Our new workspace is designed to inspire creativity and
collaboration, with open areas, quiet zones, and top-tier facilities ‚Äî all
just steps away from public transport, restaurants, bars and cultural
hotspots.

**Equal Opportunity & Inclusion**

We‚Äôre building a workplace where everyone belongs. We welcome people of all
backgrounds and identities and are proud to be a truly global team, with
employees from over 42 countries contributing their ideas, cultures, and
perspectives every day.

**German Classes**

Understanding the local culture will make your stay abroad more enjoyable, and
Crytek supports that by offering German language courses for you and your
family.

**Events**

Join us on our exciting company events, including new starter breakfasts,
summer and winter parties, our annual trip to Gamescom in Cologne, and many
more!

  

**Vacation Days**

At our Frankfurt office you can enjoy 24 days of vacation per year, and every
2 years you get 1 more (up to a maximum of 28 days). You will also have on
average 10 public holidays on top of the days you take off.

Kinsta is a modern **cloud hosting company,** with a growing club of 25,000+
customers including startups, universities and Fortune 500 firms. We're
motivated by excellent quality, and proud to have received a **97%
satisfaction rating from our customers**.

  

That's because, to us, each day is a chance to **grow**. As a team, we
continuously inspire each other to learn new and better ways to make an
impact. We own our jobs proudly - our leaders don't hold our hands, but
they're in our corner whenever we ask for help - and our environment is
**flexible** and **remote-first**.

  

As a **Revenue Operations Generalist** , you‚Äôll be the primary day-to-day
RevOps partner for our Sales organization while also expanding our analytics
and reporting capacity across GTM. This is not a narrow ‚Äúticket executor‚Äù role
‚Äî you‚Äôll take ambiguous business questions, translate them into structured
solutions, and continuously improve how our systems, automations, and
processes work.

  

Kinsta is a modern **cloud hosting company,** with a growing club of 25,000+
customers including startups, universities and Fortune 500 firms. We're
motivated by excellent quality, and proud to have received a **97%
satisfaction rating from our customers**.

  

That's because, to us, each day is a chance to **grow**. As a team, we
continuously inspire each other to learn new and better ways to make an
impact. We own our jobs proudly - our leaders don't hold our hands, but
they're in our corner whenever we ask for help - and our environment is
**flexible** and **remote-first**.

  

As a **Revenue Operations Generalist** , you‚Äôll be the primary day-to-day
RevOps partner for our Sales organization while also expanding our analytics
and reporting capacity across GTM. This is not a narrow ‚Äúticket executor‚Äù role
‚Äî you‚Äôll take ambiguous business questions, translate them into structured
solutions, and continuously improve how our systems, automations, and
processes work.

  

### What You Will Do:

* **Sales Operations (‚âà60%):**
* Serve as the main RevOps point of contact for Sales.
* Own and optimize sales workflows and automations in HubSpot (routing, territories, ownership, lifecycle transitions).
* Manage sales tools and support onboarding for new hires.
* Identify and automate repetitive manual work to improve sales efficiency.
* Produce and maintain core sales deliverables (end-of-month reports, weekly Sales Ops updates).
* Partner with Sales leadership to translate quarterly priorities into process and tooling improvements.

  

* **Analytics, Reporting & Insights (~40%):**
* Build and maintain dashboards and reporting for Sales and GTM teams.
* Deliver ad-hoc analysis with clear, actionable insights (funnels, conversion, segment or region performance).
* Define metrics, success criteria, and data definitions with stakeholders.
* Ensure data quality and consistency across systems.
* Reduce manual reporting through automation, improved data structures, and smart use of AI.

  

* **Process Ownership & Collaboration:**
* Own the sales process from a systems and data perspective and proactively reduce friction.
* Work in bi-weekly sprints with the RevOps team.
* Collaborate closely with Sales, RevOps (analytics and engineering), and other GTM teams (Marketing, CS).

  

### What You Bring To The Role:

* **3‚Äì5 years of experience in Sales Ops, RevOps** , Revenue Analytics, or a closely related role.
* Hands-on ownership of CRM processes and workflows (not just end-user usage).
* Proven experience supporting a commercial sales organization.
* **Strong HubSpot experience** (Sales Hub Enterprise; Marketing Hub Professional).
* Reporting and analytics experience: Building and maintaining dashboards and reports (Looker or similar BI tools preferred); designing reporting that answers specific business questions.
* Data & AI: Comfortable working with SQL (including AI-assisted query generation and interpretation).

  

* **Nice to Have:**
* Experience in B2B SaaS or subscription-based revenue models.
* Exposure to revenue engineering or internal tooling (integrations, API-based workflows).

  

### Our Benefits:

* **Flexible and remote-first** environment.
* **Annual remote expense budget.**
* **Flexible PTO**[.](http://pto.paid/)
* **Paid parental leave**[.](http://leave.annual/)
* **Annual professional development budget:** available after one year with Kinsta.
* **Sabbatical:** available after three years with Kinsta (and every three years thereafter).

Kinsta is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We will not discriminate
and we will take actions to ensure against discrimination in employment,
recruitment, advertisements for employment, compensation, termination,
promotions, and other conditions of employment against any employee or job
applicant on the basis of race, color, gender, national origin, citizenship,
age, religion, creed, disability, marital status, veteran‚Äôs status, sexual
orientation, gender identity, gender expression, or any other status protected
by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

  

By applying to one of our positions, you agree to the processing of the
submitted personal data in accordance with Kinsta's [Privacy
Policy](https://kinsta.com/legal/privacy-policy/), including the transfer of
your data to the United States.

postTitle: Senior Product Marketing Manager [IC3] at Sourcegraph
jobTitle: Senior Product Marketing Manager [IC3] at Sourcegraph
descContent:
### Who we are

Everything is changing in how software gets built, and Sourcegraph is at the
center of that transformation. With Code Search, Deep Search, and MCP,
Sourcegraph is the world‚Äôs most powerful code intelligence platform that
developers and agents rely on to navigate, understand, and operate on massive,
complex codebases with speed and confidence.

Teams at companies like Stripe, Uber, and Palo Alto Networks rely on
Sourcegraph to ship faster and with higher quality. We‚Äôre backed by a16z,
Sequoia, and Redpoint, and proud to operate as a globally distributed team
that values high agency, direct communication, and a deep love for developers
and their craft.

If you want to contribute to infrastructure that empowers millions of
developers to do their best work - join us.

### **Hours & location**

üåé While we hire [almost anywhere](https://sourcegraph.notion.site/How-we-
engage-talent-outside-of-the-US-218f7193695a46cbb1ef39ef9c1f72d4) in the
world, we have a preference for someone to reside in the following locations
for this role. However, if you feel qualified, we welcome you to apply
regardless of location. No matter what, working hours must overlap with
Pacific Time for at least 25 hours/week.

**Preferred locations:**

  * USA - West

### **Why this job is exciting**

We are hiring a Sr. Product Marketing Manager to help us tell the Sourcegraph
story and scale the go-to-market for one of the most critical pieces of AI
infrastructure for the largest enterprises building the future in the agentic
coding era.  
  
In this role, you will report to our Head of Marketing, and sit at the
intersection of our go-to-market and technical teams to drive thought
leadership, product leadership, and market leadership. Our customers are
developers and engineering leaders at the largest and most successful
companies in the world who rely on us to help them write better code,
understand their codebases, secure their products, and adopt the newest and
most impactful technology. You will translate deep technical capability into
clear market narratives, turn product direction into launches that land, and
ensure go-to-market is aligned, credible, and effective.  
  
Sourcegraph is a $50m ARR business, growing fast, with customers like Stripe,
OpenAI, X, Uber, JP Morgan, Morgan Stanley, Capital One,[
Booking.com](http://booking.com/), and many more. We are doubling down on our
core Search technology for the AI era, including Deep Search (agentic, natural
language search), Sourcegraph MCP and API for agents (powering coding agents
to search across and build context on the largest codebases in the world), and
critical code migration and workflow engines, like Batch Changes (large scale
code migrations) and Code Monitors (code change-driven workflows). You will be
responsible for the technical product marketing that will bring that story to
life in the market, as well as ensuring alignment with and results from our
Demand Gen and DevRel teams.  
  
We move fast and hold ourselves to an extremely high bar for product quality
and Developer authenticity. If you‚Äôve made a mark in product marketing for
developers, talk to us.

üìÖ Within one month, you will‚Ä¶

  * Ramp up quickly on the product, our audience, and the market landscape
  * Build trust with the GTM and EPD teams
  * Identify clear product marketing gaps and quick wins

üìÖ Within three months, you will‚Ä¶

  * Establish clearly defined messaging frameworks
  * Take the lead on product releases and launches
  * Create and deliver sales enablement assets
  * Establish strong operating rhythm with GTM and EPD teams

üìÖ Within six months, you will‚Ä¶

  * Make product launches and releases repeatable and predictable
  * Drive high-impact initiatives that directly influence pipe generation and deal velocity
  * Partner closely with Demand Generation and DevRel on high-impact campaigns 

üìÖ Within one year, you will‚Ä¶

  * Clearly attribute activities to revenue impact
  * Shape GTM strategy
  * Raise the bar for PMM across the organization

### **About you**

You have a track record of success in driving product marketing initiatives.
You‚Äôre equally comfortable shaping narratives that connect with our technical
enterprise audience, enabling sales, and shipping launches that move the
business forward. You understand the software development lifecycle and are
excited about how AI is reshaping developer tools and workflows.  
  
**Must-haves:**

  * 5+ years of work experience in product marketing, developer marketing, product management, or related technical marketing roles in a B2B enterprise setting.
  * Strong familiarity with developer tools and modern developer workflows, with a deep interest in AI-driven software development.
  * Proven ownership of end-to-end technical product launches, spanning positioning, field enablement, and launch execution.
  * Demonstrated ability to partner closely with technical teams to define what sets Sourcegraph apart and translate that differentiation into clear, credible, and memorable stories across channels.
  * Experience supporting enterprise sales motions and navigating complex buying cycles.
  * Strong sales enablement muscle, building and maintaining high-impact collateral and assets that scale and move enterprise deals forward.
  * Experience delivering integrated campaigns in partnership with Demand Generation, Field Marketing, and DevRel across webinars, videos, web content, and events.
  * Customer-first mindset, translating real customer feedback into messaging, positioning, and product direction.
  * Strong technical aptitude, with a deep understanding of how modern software is built, shipped, and adopted.
  * Bias toward action, moving quickly and putting bold ideas into motion.
  * Excellent written, verbal, and presentation skills.

**Nice-to-haves:**

  * Background in software engineering or software development.
  * Experience with account-based marketing (ABM) in enterprise or strategic account motions.

### **Level**

üìä This job is an IC3. You can read more about [our job leveling
philosophy](https://www.notion.so/sourcegraph/Leveling-
Guide-0e1b5c76ada64b9caac387f8b7c4fc66) in our Handbook.

### **Compensation**

**üí∏** We pay you an above-average salary because we want to hire the best
people who are fully focused on helping Sourcegraph succeed, not worried about
paying bills. As an [open and
transparent](https://sourcegraph.notion.site/Mission-
values-e9d37e6b972a4ef395c3076aea2bd07d) company that values [competitive
compensation](https://www.notion.so/sourcegraph/Compensation-Pay-Transparency-
at-Sourcegraph-d58d0774f51b4b489d41c3628d30ff8d?pvs=4), our compensation
ranges are visible to every single Sourcegraph teammate.

Your salary is determined by your pay band for the IC3 job level. For
determining pay bands, we use a number of market and data-driven salary
sources, along with your location zone, and target the high-end of the range
to ensure we‚Äôre always paying above market regardless of where you live in the
world. Both U.S. and international locations are divided into one of four
zones, determined by the cost of labor index for each area. The salary for a
successful candidate will be based on level, job-related skills, experience,
qualifications, and location zone. Please note that the salaries below may be
adjusted in the future.

üí∞ The target compensation for this role is based on the IC3 pay band for your
zone. The start of the IC3 pay band for each zone is listed below:

  * Zone 1: $158,500
  * Zone 2: $126,800
  * Zone 3: $95,100
  * Zone 4: $63,400

Please speak with a recruiter for additional information regarding zone
locations.

üìà In addition to our cash compensation, we offer equity (because when we
succeed as a company, we want you to succeed, too) and generous [perks &
benefits](https://sourcegraph.notion.site/Benefits-Perks-
dd1da4b6b3a64780abed010a144d34ba).

### **Interview process**

_Below is the interview process you can expect for this role (you can read
more about_[ _the types of interviews_](https://sourcegraph.notion.site/Types-
of-interviews-f279f080583d49ee9f2c60e30c8cb1f7) _in our Handbook). It may look
like a lot of steps, but rest assured that we move quickly and the steps are
designed to help you get the information needed to determine if we‚Äôre the
right fit for you‚Ä¶ Interviewing is a two-way street, after all!_

We expect the interview process to take 4.75 hours in total.

**üëã Introduction Stage** \- we have initial conversations to get to know you
better‚Ä¶

  * [30m] [Recruiter Screen](https://www.notion.so/sourcegraph/Types-of-interviews-sample-questions-f279f080583d49ee9f2c60e30c8cb1f7?pvs=4#99be5ff628b2414194a0ba79d9f25f13)
  * [45m] [Hiring Manager Screen](https://www.notion.so/sourcegraph/Types-of-interviews-sample-questions-f279f080583d49ee9f2c60e30c8cb1f7?pvs=4#1919882c0cf147c487eb1df40db8a694)

**üßë‚Äçüíª Team Interview Stage** \- we then delve into your experience in more
depth and introduce you to members of the team, including cross-functional
partners‚Ä¶

  * [60m] [Resume Deep Dive](https://www.notion.so/sourcegraph/Types-of-interviews-sample-questions-f279f080583d49ee9f2c60e30c8cb1f7?pvs=4#c678a2a86e0e47e4958507e869bf7ded)
  * [60m] [Working Session](https://sourcegraph.notion.site/Marketing-Interview-Process-7468b9f6f1524c46944ae1a3d883c641?source=copy_link)

**üéâ Final Interview Stage** \- we move you to our final round, where you gain
a better understanding of our business and values holistically‚Ä¶

  * [30m] [Values](https://www.notion.so/sourcegraph/Types-of-interviews-sample-questions-f279f080583d49ee9f2c60e30c8cb1f7?pvs=4#e3a04291743048df87541a88aa8199dd)

  * We check references and conduct your background check

Please note - you are welcome to request additional conversations with anyone
you would like to meet, but didn‚Äôt get to meet during the interview process.

### Learn more about us

You can learn more about what it is like to work at Sourcegraph by reading
[our
handbook](https://sourcegraph.notion.site/d7614e3e9dc04c09ac2d42d57f1816e6?v=2a6d426dbae14390b155120b0c029ce0).

dd1da4b6b3a64780abed010a144d34ba?pvs=74) here.

Sourcegraph is an equal opportunity workplace; we welcome people from all
backgrounds.

Verify_](https://sourcegraph.notion.site/E-Verify-2ab3286dde3446d6bac2898c83610107)

Kinsta is one of the top-managed **WordPress hosting companies,** with a
growing club of 120,000+ businesses including startups, universities and
Fortune 500 firms. We're motivated by excellent quality, and proud to have
received a**97% satisfaction rating from our customers**.

  

That's because, to us, each day is a chance to **grow**. As a team, we
continuously inspire each other to learn new and better ways to make an
impact. We own our jobs proudly - our leaders don't hold our hands, but
they're in our corner whenever we ask for help - and our environment is
**flexible** and **remote-first.**

  

As our new Support Engineer, you'll use your technical knowledge, curiosity,
and eloquence to provide world-class technical support to our customers
through our live chat system. Reporting to the Support Manager, you will join
the beating heart of Kinsta - a team embodying our DNA and desire to provide
industry-leading support.

  

This role's shift needs are **4 PM‚Äî12 AM UTC**(our team uses UTC for
scheduling).

As our new Support Engineer, you'll use your technical knowledge, curiosity,
and eloquence to provide world-class technical support to our customers
through our live chat system. Reporting to the Support Manager, you will join
the beating heart of Kinsta - a team embodying our DNA and desire to provide
industry-leading support.

  

This role's shift needs are **4 PM‚Äî12 AM UTC**(our team uses UTC for
scheduling).

### What You Will Do:

* Take ownership of issues reported by customers and see problems through to resolution.
* Research, troubleshoot, and identify solutions to resolve customer issues.
* Follow standard procedures for proper escalation of unresolved issues to the appropriate internal teams.
* Provide prompt and accurate feedback to customers.
* Crave knowledge and continue to hone and improve your own technical and non-technical skills.

### What You Bring To The Role:

* You are completely fluent in English with excellent written communication skills.
* Great customer service skills with online customer service experience. 

### Bonus Points If You:

* Have experience with the following technologies: Linux, NGINX, MySQL/MariaDB, PHP, DNS, CDN, and caching (object and page).
* Have an understanding of WordPress: database structure, file/directory structure, wp-config.php directives, and other common WordPress topics. Experience with WP-CLI is preferable.
* Are comfortable navigating within a command line environment, including file management, reading and interpreting server logs, and attention to detail with command line syntax.
* Have familiarity with Cloudflare, Buildpacks, Dockerfiles, third-party Git repository services (such as GitHub, GitLab, and Bitbucket), npm, or Composer is beneficial.

### Our Benefits:

* **Annual remote expense budge** t.
* **Flexible PTO.**
* **Paid parental leave.**
* **Annual professional development budget:** available after one year with Kinsta.
* **Sabbatical:** available after three years with Kinsta (and every three years thereafter).
* **Location-specific healthcare benefits** (includes vision and dental) for employees hired in the USA, UK, Canada, and Hungary.
* **Pension plan** for employees hired in the UK, and 401k contributions for employees hired in the USA

Kinsta is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We will not discriminate
and we will take actions to ensure against discrimination in employment,
recruitment, advertisements for employment, compensation, termination,
promotions, and other conditions of employment against any employee or job
applicant on the basis of race, color, gender, national origin, citizenship,
age, religion, creed, disability, marital status, veteran‚Äôs status, sexual
orientation, gender identity, gender expression, or any other status protected
by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

  

By applying to one of our positions, you agree to the processing of the
submitted personal data in accordance with Kinsta's [Privacy
Policy](https://kinsta.com/legal/privacy-policy/), including the transfer of
your data to the United States.
